events.event_description: U.S. crude oil production reached a record high of 13.3 million barrels per day in December 2023, breaking both U.S. and global production records.
events.citation: Average monthly U.S. crude oil production established a monthly record high in December 2023 at more than 13.3 million b/d.

events.event_description: Saudi Aramco canceled its plans to increase production capacity to 13.0 million barrels per day by 2027.
events.citation: Saudi Arabia's state-owned Saudi Aramco recently scrapped plans to increase production capacity to 13.0 million b/d by 2027.

events.event_description: Russia announced additional voluntary production cuts of 500,000 barrels per day in response to sanctions and the Ukraine invasion.
events.citation: More recently, Russia was among the OPEC+ countries that announced production cuts in November 2022, and in February 2023, it separately announced additional voluntary cuts of 500,000 b/d.

events.event_description: Saudi Arabia reduced crude oil production by 900,000 barrels per day due to OPEC+ cuts and voluntary reductions to offset weak demand.
events.citation: In 2023, crude oil production in Saudi Arabia declined by about 900,000 b/d because of OPEC+ cuts and further voluntary cuts Saudi Arabia made to offset weaker demand growth.

events.event_description: U.S. crude oil production in the Permian Basin has been driving increases in total U.S. crude oil and natural gas production.
events.citation: In recent years, crude oil production in the Permian Basin (in western Texas and eastern New Mexico) drove the increases in total crude oil and natural gas production in the United States.
